data.title: Sorokin, Ivan
data.text:
1922-2004

View exposition

People’s Artist of the Russian Federation (1990).

Associate of the Russian Academy of Arts

Member of the Artists’ Union (USSR, 1955)

Honorary Artist of the Russian Federation

Secretary of the Board of the Artist’s Union (USSR, 1988–1992)

Member of the Russian Academy of Arts (1997)

Awarded:

• Ilya Repin State Prize of the Russian Federation (1980)

• Gold medal of the Russian Academy of Arts (1999)

• Moscow Government prize in the field of literature and arts for a series of paintings dedicated to Moscow (2000)

1943–1945 – studied art in the Mitrofan Grekov studio of war painters

1945–1961 – a student of Sergei Gerasimov at the Surikov Art Institute

His paintings can be found in

• Tretyakov Gallery (Moscow)

• Russian Museum (St. Petersburg)

• public museums and private collections in Russia, UK, France, Italy, Spain, Japan, USA, Belgium and Canada.

Exhibitions:

Ivan Sorokin began to show his paintings at public art exhibitions in 1944. His paintings were exhibited in UK, France, Italy, Netherlands, Belgium, Japan, Sweden, Canada and other countries.

Personal exhibitions:

Sorokin had his one-man shows in Moscow (1980, 1992 and 1998) and Berlin (1997).
